My Dear Sir
|Captain E.E. Morgan|New York City|U.S. of America|
BONCHURCH, ISLE OF WIGHTCD was in the Isle of Wight with his family from 26 July to 1 October. 1849-07-27
My Dear Sir
body.p: The date of this letter will I hope explain to you why we have not been able to avail ourselves of your kind and welcome invitation, which only arrived here last night.Morgan captained the Southampton on its inaugural voyage across the Atlantic in June 1849. It docked at Gravesend on 6 July (‘Money-Market and City Intelligence’, Times, 6 July 1849), and then travelled on to London. It left London for the return journey to New York on 28 July (‘Regular Line of Packets between London and New York’, Times, 4 June 1849).
